title: Review: Place Tags
goal: Review all five place tags with complex sentences.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Conversion review:

te dunda = ? receives
ve vecnu = ? is the price

Convert: mi vecnu la cukta do ci no → ? (with ve)

(Answer: ci no ve vecnu la cukta do mi)

New Material (5-7 min)

Place Tags Review

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
terpa x1 fears x2 fear
tatpi x1 is tired from x2 tired

The Five Tags

Tag Marks Mnemonic
fa x1 first argument
fe x2 second
fi x3 third
fo x4 fourth
fu x5 fifu (fifth)

Full Tag Practice with klama

klama: x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 using x5

Scrambled order with tags:

fi la .paris. fo la dargu fu la karce fa mi cu klama fe la .london.

Decoded:

  • fi (x3) = la .paris. (from Paris)
  • fo (x4) = la dargu (via road)
  • fu (x5) = la karce (by car)
  • fa (x1) = mi (I)
  • fe (x2) = la .london. (to London)

Meaning: I go to London from Paris via the road by car.

Tags with Three-Place Gismu

dunda: x1 gives x2 to x3

Order Sentence
Normal mi dunda la cukta la .bob.
Tagged fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta fi la .bob.
Gift first fe la cukta fa mi cu dunda fi la .bob.
Recipient first fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta

Mixing Tags and Positional

After a tag, untagged sumti fill remaining places:

fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda la cukta
  • fi (x3) = la .bob.
  • fa (x1) = mi
  • la cukta = x2 (positional after selbri)

Key Point

Tags provide explicit place marking. With practice, you can read and produce any word order.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Decode Tagged Sentences

Identify all places:

  1. fi la .alis. fa mi cu dunda fe la skami

    • x1 = ?, x2 = ?, x3 = ?

  2. fo la dargu fu la karce fa do cu klama fe la zarci fi la zdani

    • x1 = ?, x2 = ?, x3 = ?, x4 = ?, x5 = ?
Answers

  1. x1 = mi, x2 = la skami, x3 = la .alis. (I give a computer to Alice.)

  2. x1 = do, x2 = la zarci, x3 = la zdani, x4 = la dargu, x5 = la karce (You go to the market from home via the road by car.)

Exercise 2: Write with Tags

Rewrite with explicit tags, recipient first:

  1. mi dunda la cukta la .bob. → ?
  2. la .alis. cu benji la notci mi → ?
Answers
  1. fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta
  2. fi mi fa la .alis. cu benji fe la notci

Exercise 3: Use New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. I fear the dog.
  2. Bob is tired.
  3. The dog is feared by me. (use se or tags)
Answers
  1. mi terpa la gerku
  2. la .bob. cu tatpi
  3. la gerku se terpa mi or fe la gerku fa mi cu terpa

items.text: `fi la .alis. fa mi cu dunda fe la skami`
items.answer: x1 = mi, x2 = la skami, x3 = la .alis.

items.text: `fo la dargu fu la karce fa do cu klama fe la zarci fi la zdani`
items.answer: x1 = do, x2 = la zarci, x3 = la zdani, x4 = la dargu, x5 = la karce
`fi la .bob. fa mi cu dunda fe la cukta`
`fi mi fa la .alis. cu benji fe la notci`

items.text: The dog is feared by me. (use `se` or tags)
items.answer: `la gerku se terpa mi` or `fe la gerku fa mi cu terpa`

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I give a book to Alice." (tagged, gift first) → fe la cukta fa mi cu dunda fi la .alis.
  2. "I am tired." → mi tatpi
  3. "I fear this." → mi terpa ti

Today's Vocab

Lojban Place Structure English

tatpi x1 is tired from x2 tired

Summary

You reviewed all five place tags. Tags allow any word order through explicit place marking.
